metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19911 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is a DoS vulnerability in Pillow before 6.2.2 caused by FpxImagePlugin.py calling the range function on an unvalidated 32-bit integer if the number of bands is large. On Windows running 32-bit Python, this results in an OverflowError or MemoryError due to the 2 GB limit. However, on Linux running 64-bit Python this results in the process being terminated by the OOM killer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.2
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.2
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.2').
